Powers of an Element

For an element $a \in M$ of a monoid and an exponent $n \in \mathbb{N}$, the $n$th power of $a$, denoted $a^n$, is defined in the usual way. Note that $a^0 = e$, following the convention on empty products.
Order of a group
The order of a group $G$, denoted as ord $G$, is defined as the number of elements in $G$ if $G$ is finite. If $G$ is infinite, its order is said to be infinite.
Leading Coefficient

For a polynomial f=
sum a_i X^i in R[X] with deg f=n 
geq 0, the coefficient a_n is called the leading coefficient. If a_n=1, the polynomial is called monic.
Ring Homomorphism

Let $R$ and $R'$ be rings. A map $\varphi: R \longrightarrow R'$ is called a ring homomorphism if it satisfies two conditions: (i) $\varphi(a+b)=\varphi(a)+\varphi(b)$ for all $a, b \in R$, making $\varphi$ a group homomorphism with respect to addition, and (ii) $\varphi(a \cdot b)=\varphi(a) \cdot \varphi(b)$ for all $a, b \in R$ and $\varphi(1)=1$, making $\varphi$ a monoid homomorphism with respect to multiplication.
Ring Automorphism
An automorphism of a ring $R$ is an isomorphism $\varphi: R \longrightarrow R$.
Prime Element

An element $p$ in a unique factorization domain $R$ is called a prime element if it generates a prime ideal, i.e., the ideal $(p)$ is such that if $p$ divides a product of elements in $R$, then $p$ divides at least one of those elements.
Galois Group of a Polynomial Splitting Fields
The Galois group of a polynomial equation is the group of automorphisms of the splitting field of the polynomial that fix the base field. These automorphisms permute the roots of the polynomial.
Frobenius homomorphism

For a field $K$ of characteristic $p>0$, the map $\sigma: K \longrightarrow K, \quad a \longmapsto a^{p}$, which respects the addition on $K$, defines a homomorphism of fields known as the Frobenius homomorphism of $K$.
K-homomorphism
A field homomorphism \\(\sigma: L \longrightarrow L'\\) between two field extensions \\(L / K\\) and \\(L' / K\\) is called a \\(K\\)-homomorphism if it restricts to the identity map on \\(K\\).
Galois extension
An extension $K_{r} / K$ is Galois if it is both normal and separable.
Dihedral Group

The dihedral group $D_{n}$, for $n \geq 3$, is the group of symmetries (rotations and reflections) of a regular (convex) $n$-gon. It is generated by the permutations $\sigma = (1, \ldots, n)$ and $\tau = \left(\begin{array}{ccccc}1 & 2 & 3 & \ldots & n \\ 1 & n & n-1 & \ldots & 2\end{array}\right)$.
Kernel of Map
The kernel of \( f \) is defined as:\[\mathrm{Ker}(f) = \{ a \in A \mid f(a) = 0 \} and is hence a subset of the Domain A.\]
